event.title: 1877, the Hebard and Thurberg Lumber Company leased

data.event: In 1877, the Hebard and Thurberg Lumber Company leased the peninsula from the chief, David King.

event.title: built a large steam-powered sawmill the following year

data.event: They built a large steam-powered sawmill the following year and established sixteen lumber camps.
The principal Chippewa village, known as Pe-qua-qua-wa-ming, is now Pequaming.

event.title: June 1914 were Tobias Hilunen and his family, who purchased

data.event: The first settlers in June 1914 were Tobias Hilunen and his family, who purchased Camp Number 3 and which had buildings in habitable condition.
Other Finnish families arrived later that summer.
